In the case of Reyna, 39, (President) she’s been selling beauty products for five years and during the afternoons she sells sandals to her best customers.  She will use the present loan to buy beauty products for her business and to continue with her footwear sales.

It’s worth pointing out the enthusiasm and wish to continue moving forward with effort and dedication toward wellbeing and improvement for each one of the communal bank’s members.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Belfar David

texts.es: EL Sr. Belfar tiene 37 años  es casado pero no tiene  hijos, el se dedica al servicio de  alquiler de amplificación a distintos acontecimientos sociales, como ser bautizos, matrimonios y toda clase de acontecimientos,  solicito este  préstamo para arreglo de vehículo ya que  esto le permitirá transportar sus amplificadores ya que son muy pesados y tiene que transportar a los distintos acontecimientos,  Belfar  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son competencia y  utilizara los beneficios para mejorar sus bienes y sueña  con  ampliar su amplificación, es una persona emprendedora con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Belfar, 37, is married but does not have children.  He has a business renting sound equipment to a variety of social functions, such as baptisms, weddings and other types of social events.  He is requesting a loan to fix his vehicle, because this will allow him to transport his amplifiers.  These amplifiers are very heavy, and he has to transport them to different events.  Belfar faces challenges in his business, including the competition.  He will use the profits from his business to improve his equipment, as he dreams of having more sound equipment.  He is an enterprising person who has a strong desire to excel.  He is happy and grateful to this institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to fix his vehicle so that he can transport his sound equipment

loans.name: Rahama

texts.en:
Rahama lives in Yambio where she has been operating a food stall for the past year. She is 27 years old, married, and has four children, all of them in school.

Rahama, who learned about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, is requesting her first loan from BRAC for 400 SDG in order to purchase onions and oil for resale. She will use the resulting extra income to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and oil for resale.

loans.name: Faraj

texts.en: Faraj, a 26-year-old single man from Gaza, works in agriculture selling sheep. Now requesting this loan in order to buy sheep for his farm, Faraj hopes the loan will improve his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy sheep for his farm.

loans.name: Ilyos

texts.ru: Ильёс парень 30 лет, женат имеет одного ребёнка. Он занимается профессиональной съёмкой и монтажом свадебных мероприятий, а также имеет точку по продаже DVD дисков. Ильес ответственно относится к своей работе и поэтому качество его видеосъёмок на высоком уровне. На его съемку очень хороший спрос и у него много заказов. На получаемый кредит Ильес собирается приобрести партию DVD дисков.
texts.en: Ilyos is a 30 year-old guy who is married and has one child. He is a professional cameraman and editor of wedding videos, and also has a retail outlet where he sells DVDs. Ilyos has a very responsible attitude towards his work, which is why his videos are of the highest quality. There is a lot of demand for his work and he has many orders. Using this loan, Ilyos would like to purchase a shipment of DVDs.

loans.use: to buy a shipment of DVDs

loans.name: Jaime Gonzalo

texts.es:
Jaime, de oficio comerciante se dedica a las ventas de CD de música, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad en la ciudad de Estelí. Este negocio lo empezó cuando tenía 20 años de edad, lo puso con capital que tenia ahorrado de su antiguo trabajo, el trabajaba en tiendas de supermercado pero un día decidió emprender su propio negocio.  El tenia muy poca mercadería vendía muy poco CDs de música ahora vender además de eso gafas de sol, bolsos para celulares, limas. Así poco a poco ha ido surtiendo su negocio. 
El realizo el crédito para comprar CDs, gafas, cartucheras de celular. Su idea es ir variando los productos que vende y que son de uso popular. Lograr tener una tienda de mercadería en general y  tener capital para darle un techo digno a su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime, whose business is selling music CDs, has been working this way for ten years in the city of Estelí. He began this business when he was twenty years old. He started out with capital he had saved from his previous job, working in a supermarket. One day he decided to start his own business. He had very little merchandise and sold few music CDs. Now, in addition to CDs he sells sunglasses, cellphone cases, and shirts. Little by little, he has supplied his business this way.
He has requested the loan to purchase CDs, sunglasses, and cellphone cases. His idea is to continue varying the products he sells which are currently popular. He hopes to have a general merchandise store and have the capital to provide his family with a roof over its head.

loans.use: to purchase CDs, sunglasses, and cellphone cases.

loans.name: Rajaboi

texts.ru: Рачабой добрый и порядочный человек, который имеет хорошую дружную семью и троих детей. Более 11 лет занимается купле- продажей скота и одновременно занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур. Отходы от выращивания культур идут на корм скота. В бизнесе помогает жена. Рачабой запрашивает займ для покупки двух голов крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. А также на остальную сумму хочет купить семена пшеницы и ячменя. Рачабой надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Rajaboi is a kind and decent man who has a nice loving family with three children. For over 11 years, he has been raising livestock and growing crops. Rajaboi uses the waste from crops to feed his animals. His wife helps him with the business. Rajaboi is requesting this loan to purchase two new animals for his herd. Using the remaining money, he would like to buy wheat and barley seeds. Rajaboi hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock and seeds

loans.name: El Charquito Group

texts.es:
La señora Edith tiene  treinta y seis años de edad, ella pertenece a una localidad llamada El charquito un lugar bonito donde hay un rió hermoso donde las personas van a bañarse  y pasar un lindo fin de semana con su familia.
Doña Edith nos cuenta que esta orgullosa de la comunidad donde vive y de sus paisanos ya que son personas trabajadoras y honestas que se dedican a diversas actividades económicas.
Doña Edi como mejor la conocen sus compañeras de grupo  se dedica a la venta de comida como son: caldos de pollo, caldo de res con verduras, tacos blanditos de cecina, carne enchilada, tripa, empanadas de pollo y quesillo y a la venta de refrescos, sabritas y yogurt.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Antonio un señor trabajador y honesto que se dedica al trabajo de campo como es la siembra de maíz.
Tiene la cantidad de  cuatro hijos Everardo, Karen Arlet, Yamilet e Ingrid Yaret ellos son el motivo por el cual cada día se levanta con fuerzas para trabajar y superarse para que sus hijos estén orgullosos  de su madre.
Ella nos cuenta una de las experiencias mas lindas de su negocio: "hace dos años  solamente vendía tacos de tripa y de cecina y  decidí acudir a Fundación  para recibir un préstamo", gracias al préstamo compró mas carnes y verduras y unas mesas y así trabajar mas tiempo ya que también decidió vender cenas y con el paso del tiempo decidió vender almuerzos, comidas y cenas, y con sus ganancias comprar jugos, refrescos y sabritas, yogurt y verduras chile carne y un refrigerador grande, y al final remodelo su negocio para que estuviera mas amplio y llame la atención y den ganas de sentarse a comer en lugar limpio con una  comida bien sabrosa y con tortillas ellas a manos.
Lo que mas la llena de alegría a  Doña Edith es saber que con el apoyo de fundacion ha podido hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar la vida de sus hijos para que con el  paso del tiempo  puedan tenerlos recursos para cumplir sus sueños.
Doña Edith Utilizo su préstamo para la compra de más ingredientes para la elaboraron de comida como es: chiles verdes, chiles secos, cebolla, verduras, carne de res, carne de pollo, quesos y  más refrescos para la venta.
Ella nos dice que esta contenta por todo lo que le ha dado como haber conocido a fundacion ya que es como su familia por que le ayudo a ser realidad sus sueños que  es tener su taqueria.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son: 
Teodora-quien se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Adelina- se dedica a la venta de tacos.
Catalina-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Rosa-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Virginia- quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Hortensia-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Ángela Rutila -quien se dedica a la venta de materias primas.
Antonia-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Argelia –quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Ana Maria-quien se dedica a la venta de tacos.
Dominoza-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Teodora Marina -quien se dedica a la venta de pan.
Evodía-quien se dedica a la venta de pollo.
Le dan las gracias a fundacion por el apoyo que les ha dado  para que puedan hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar sus vidas y su comunidad tenga mas comercios.
texts.en:
Señora Edith is 36.  She belongs to a town called El Charquito in a nice place where there is a beautiful river where people go swimming and spend nice weekends with their families.  Doña Edith tells us that she is proud of the community where she lives, and her compatriots are hard-working and honest people that are dedicated to various economic activities.

Doña Edi, as her group members call her, sells food like: chicken soup, beef and vegetable soup, soft tacos with cured meat, enchilada meat, intestines, and cheese and chicken empanadas.  She also sells soft drinks, Sabrita-brand snacks, and yogurt.

She is happily married to señor Antonio, a hard-working and honest man who works in the field harvesting corn.  She has four children:  Everardo, Karen Arlet, Yamilet, and Ingrid Yaret.  They are the reason she gets up every day with strength to work and improve herself so her children will be proud of their mother.

She told us one of her best experiences with her business:  "Two years ago, I only sold tacos made with intestines or cured meat.  I decided to approach the Fundación to receive a loan."  Thanks to the loan, she bought more meat and vegetables and some tables to work more.  She also decided to sell cured meat, and with time, she started selling lunches, meals, and dinners.  With what she earned, she bought juices, soft drinks, Sabrita-brand snacks, yogurt, vegetables, hot peppers, meat, and a large refrigerator.  She finally remodeled her business so that it was bigger and to call attention to it so people would want to sit down to eat in a clean place with very delicious food and hand-made tortillas.

What most fills Doña Edith with happiness is knowing that with the support of the Fundación, she has been able to grow her business and improve the life of her children so that as time passes, they will have the resources they need to fulfill their dreams.

Doña Edith used her loan to buy more ingredients to make food like:  green chilis, dried chilis, onions, vegetables, beef, chicken, cheeses, and more soft drinks to sell.

She tells us that she is happy for everything that has been given to her like becoming familiar with the Fundación, which is like her family because it helped her make her dreams a reality, which was to have her own taco business.

The other members of the group are:

Teodora - who sells chickens
Adelina - who sells tacos
Catalina - who sells clothing
Rosa - who sells clothing
Virginia - who sells clothing
Hortensia - who sells Mexican comfort food
Ángela Rutila - who sells raw matierals
Antonia - who sells clothing
Argelia –who sells clothing
Ana Maria - who sells tacos
Dominoza - who sells Mexican comfort food
Teodora Marina - who sells bread
Evodía - who sells chickens

They are thankful to the Funcación for the support it has given them so they can grow their businesses and improve their lives and so their community will have more businesses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Abdurazak

texts.ru: Абдуразаку 46  лет, женат,имеет 4 детей. Он добрый,трудолюбивый,отзывчивый человек.Уже 20 лет занимается производством национальных лепешек.У него много клиентов.Он мастер своего дела.Среди населения имеет свой авторитет.Это деятельность осталась ему от отца.Он очень любит свою работу и гордится выпечкой вкусных лепешек. Он кредитуется в МДО "Арванд" уже 4 года и благодарен нашей организации. На полученный кредит Абдуразак хочет закупить муку так как цена на муку снизилась.
texts.en: Abdurazak is 46 years old, married, and has 4 children. He is a kind, hard-working and compassionate person. For 20 years he has been making traditional flat-breads. Abdurazak is a master of his trade, has many clients, and is highly regarded by the populace. He inherited this occupation from his father. Abdurazak loves his work and is proud of making delicious flat-breads. He has been a client of MDO Arvand, LLC for 4 years, and is grateful for their support. Using this loan, Abdurazak would like to purchase flour as its price has recently dropped.

loans.use: to purchase flour for his bakery

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora lives in Yambio. She is 35 years old and married. She has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Nora sells fuel. She has been in business for three years. She heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. She has requested a loan of SDG 3000 in order to purchase fuel. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees. This is her forth loan from BRAC.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for sale.

loans.name: Reforma Group

texts.es:
Flora cuenta con 57 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo y un sobrino los cuales están a su cargo su hijo tiene 11 años y esta en 6° de primaria mientras que el sobrino llamado Marcial  ya es mayor de edad y pronto contraerá matrimonio con su novia, el esposo de Flora se llama Calixto y es policía munipal y la apoya en el negocio.
Ella es comerciante venta de frutas y verduras ya tiene 34 años con el negocio lo cual dice que le va muy bien con el negocio pues ella ya tiene experiencia en su negocio y espera que el préstamo le ayude así para sacar adelante el negocio ya que le gustaría incrementar mas el negocio ya que es un buen negocio le esta echando todas las ganas trabajando día a día para sacarlo adelante. Ella da las gracias por el apoyo brindado que le fue de gran utilidad.
Flora pertenece al grupo Reforma cuyo nombre es por la colonia de donde viven el grupo esta compuesto por 11 personas todas mujeres trabajadoras a continuación eran mencionadas: Eulogia, Luz María, Rosa, Yazmín, Alejandra, Olga, Feliciana, Juana, Cirila, Dianaleydi, todas realizan actividades comercial como son: carnicería, ropa, venta de productos por catalogo, perfumes, frutas y verduras, artículos de bisutería, productos de abarrotes, etc.
texts.en:
Flora, 57, is married and has a child and a nephew who are in her care.  Her son is 11, and is in 6th grade, while her nephew, Marcial, is an adult and will soon marry his fiancee.  Flora's husband is named Calixto.  He is a policeman and he also helps her with her business.

Flora is a merchant who has been selling fruits and vegetables for 34 years.  She says that her business is going very well.  She already has experience with her business and she expects that this loan will help her to get ahead with her business, as she would like to grow the business more.  Because it is a good business, she is always giving it her best each day so that she can make progress with it.  Flora gives her thanks for the support provided, which has been very helpful to her.

Flora belongs to the communal bank "Reforma," which is named after the neighborhood where the members live.  This group has 11 members, who are all hardworking women.  The group includes: Eulogia, Luz María, Rosa, Yazmín, Alejandra, Olga, Feliciana, Juana, Cirila, and Dianaleydi.  They all work as merchants, selling items such as: meat, clothing, products through a catalog, perfumes, fruits and vegetables, accessories and costume jewelry, groceries, etc.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables such as: apples, oranges, beans, chilis, and tomatoes

loans.name: Grupo Guasaule 4 Group

texts.es:
Doña  Luz  es  un  señora muy trabajadora  dedicado  a su trabajo,  madre soltera, ella tiene 2  hijos   mayores  de  edad y   le  ayudan  en  la  parte  económica.  Doña Luz tiene su negocio   en  la  aduana  de  Guasaule, en  el  sur  de  Honduras.  Desde hace  mas  de  15  años se  dedica   a  Lo que  es  la  venta  de  comida y pollo  frito.  Doña  Luz  el  préstamo lo necesita   Para  la  compra  de  pollo, canes, lácteos y  condimentos. Este crédito  le  ayudara   ya  que  tendrá  capital  fresco para invertir   ya  que  trabaja  con algunos clientes y les da  crédito, Doña Luz sueña   con comprar un  micro bus  para  a si tener  mejores  ingresos  para  bienestar  de  sus  hijos.
Kenia,  se  dedica  a la  venta  de  comida  en la  aduana  de  Guasaule  desde  hace  mas  de  3  años y  actualmente    vive  con  su  esposo.
Mirna, se  dedica  a la  venta  de  ropa  nueva   desde hace  mas  de   4  años, es madre  de  2  hijos  y  actualmente  vive  con su  esposo.



Choluteca, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Luz is a very hardworking woman who is dedicated to her work. She is a single mother with two adult children who help her financially. Luz has her business in the border town of Guasaule, in southern Honduras. For more than fifteen years she has sold fried chicken and other foods. Luz is requesting the loan to purchase chicken, sugar, dairy products, and condiments. This loan will help her to have fresh capital to invest since she already works with some clients who provide her with credit. Luz dreams of purchasing a microbus to earn more revenue and provide for her children’s well-being.
Kenia, who has worked for more than three years selling food in the border town of Guasaule, currently lives with her husband.
Mirna, who has worked for more than four years selling new clothing, is the mother of two children and currently lives with her husband.

Choluteca, Honduras – March 2012

loans.use: to purchase soda pop, beef, chicken, pork, and condiments for her business.

loans.name: Vianca Maribel

texts.es:
Vianca tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera, y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Mochumí, ubicado a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a la crianza y venta de animales, el cría aves de corral y animales menores en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan con frecuencia la zona. Esta actividad le provee de una fuente estable de ingresos con los cuales saca adelante a su joven familia. Adicionalmente tiene una bodega donde ofrece abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad y ropa.

Vianca desea mejorar la crianza de sus animales adquiriendo alimento balanceado de modo que puedan ser vendidos a un mejor precio, además de comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales.  Y, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Vianca is 27 and single.  She lives with her family in the district of Mochumí, which is located 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the department of Lambayeque.

She has raised and sold animals for two years.  She raises poultry and small animals behind her home.  When they have reached a good level of development, she sells them to businesspeople that frequent the area.  This work has proven to be a stable source of income for her and helps her young family get ahead.  She also has a small bodega where she sells groceries, basic goods, and clothing.

Vianca hopes to improve on raising her animals by acquiring nutritious food for them so she can sell them at a better price.  To accomplish her goal, she saw it necessary to request her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1,500 PEN.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock her store and to buy nutritious food for her livestock.

loans.name: Halimajon

texts.ru: Халимачон 1951 года рождения, имеет 2 сыновей. Она реализует оптом пластиковые сетки и другие хозяйственные товары. Практически у нее круглый год реализация и сезонность. Ее лавка находиться на центральном рынке города. Халимачон сотрудничает с нашей организации с 2009 года. Стаж торговли на рынке почти 15 лет. Она очень была рада сотрудничеству с нашей организацией и  благодарна за финансовую поддержку
texts.en: Halimajon was born in 1951. She has 2 sons. She is engaged in bulk sales of plastic netting and other household goods. Halimajon makes sales virtually year-round, and stocks seasonal products. Her shop is located at the city's central market. Halimajon has been a client of MDO Arvand, LLC since 2009, and has almost 15 years of experience selling goods at the market. She has been glad to work with MDO Arvand, LLC and is grateful for their financial support.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa lives in Yambio. She sells clothes, and has been in business for 3 years. She is 38 years old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Teresa heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fifth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2500 SDG in order to purchase clothes. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a 39-year-old man from the Nyamusi area and is married to Bethsheba. They have four children aged 6 to 18 years. 

Nicholas operates a business selling clothes, a business that he has been doing for the last 6 years making a monthly income of KES 15,000. He has applied  for his fourth loan from KADET LTD., which he will use to buy a stock of used clothing for sale. 

His profits will be used to add more stock of clothing for sale. Nicolas' dream is to increase his stock of clothing to meet his clients' demands.

loans.use: To buy a stock of used clothing for sale.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.ru: Наргиза торгует на рынке около 12 лет. За товаром ездит сама в Истаравшан.ЕЕ товар состоит из женской одежды и  национальных платков . В весенний период у нее начинается сезон продаж. На полученный кредит, она планирует закупить товар весеннего сезона. Новый товар будет стоять дороже чем прошлогодний, так как уже поставщики выставляют товар по новой цене.Поэтому Наргиза получает у нас очередной кредит, и благодарит за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Nargis has been a seller at the market for approximately 12 years. She travels to Istaravshan to purchase her products - women's clothing and traditional scarves. Her sales season begins in the springtime. Using this loan, Nargis is planning to stock up on spring goods. The new products will be more expensive than last years' since suppliers have increased their prices. This is why Nargis is requesting another loan from MDO Arvand, LLC and thanks them for their support.

loans.use: to purchase spring products for her shop

loans.name: Juan Angel

texts.es: Juan, habitante de Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, de 47 años de edad, casado, padre de 3 hijos.  El es agricultor se dedica a la siembra de café orgánico. El empezó a especializarse en las siembras de café cuando un amigo cercano lo dijo que este tipo de cultivo era muy  rentable debido a que las tierras que posee prestan las características óptimas para siembras de café. Pues antes el solo cultivaba maíz, frijoles y en ocasiones se dedica a la carpintería. El vende su producto dentro de su comunidad pero le gustaría vender fuera del país para dar a conocer más su café y conseguir un mejor precio.  El usara este crédito para comprar insumo y pagar mano de obra que necesita para sembrar ½ manzana de café.  Con la ganancia quiere seguir invirtiendo en ampliar las áreas de siembra de  café orgánico.
texts.en: Juan, who lives in the municipality of Pueblo Nuevo in Estelí, is 47 years old, married, and the father of three children. He is a farmer who cultivates organic coffee. He began to specialize in coffee cultivation when a close friend told him that this type of crop is very profitable, especially since the land he possesses has optimal characteristics for coffee cultivation. Before, he only raised corn and beans, and on occasion he did some carpentry. He sells his product within his community, but he would like to sell outside his country to increase his coffee’s market and to obtain a better price. He will use this loan to purchase supplies and to cover labor costs to cultivate about an acre of coffee. He wants to use the profits to continue investing by increasing the lands on which he cultivates organic coffee.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and to cover labor costs to cultivate about an acre of coffee.

loans.name: Aty Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas. Las mismas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras. Desean poder ayudarse las unas a las otras y de esa forma mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Sonia, presidenta del grupo, está casada, tiene una hija, y nos comenta que tanto ella y su marido luchan por darle a esa hija todo lo mejor y evitar que tenga que sufrir privaciones. Ella vende todo tipo de ropas y nos comenta que ya tiene muy buena clientela y muchos pedidos, es por ello que solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo para la posterior venta.
texts.en:
This committee is from the City of San Lorenzo.  The members of the committee have as their main objective the growth of each one of them.  They are known in the area as very hard-working women.  They want to help each other and in this way improve their living conditions.  

Sonia, the president of the group, is married, has one daughter, and she tells us that both she and her husband struggle to give their daughter the best of everything and avoid her having to suffer privations.  She sells clothing of all types and she tells us that she has very good customers and many orders.  Because of this she is seeking a loan to buy garments of all types to later sell.

loans.use: to purchase garments for sale.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Carlos, de 33 años de edad, está casado y tiene dos hijos de 6 y 12 años de edad con su esposa  y vive en  una aldea de Choloma, Cortes.
Carlos, hace un año que estableció un negocio de una pulpería, donde vende productos de consumo diario, como ser arroz, frijoles, harina, pastas, azúcar, refrescos, etc. Para  atender  a los clientes le ayuda su esposa, el trabaja en una textilera dos veces por semana  de donde obtiene otros ingresos y los otros días le dedica a la pulpería. 
El préstamo que solicita es de 10,000.00 y lo va invertir en la compra de productos alimenticios como granos básicos, azúcar,  refrescos etc. Ha obtenido tres préstamos anteriores los que le han ayudado a incrementar las ventas.
Su meta es mantener siempre surtido el negocio para tener producto disponible para los clientes.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 33, is married and has two children, ages 6 and 12.  He lives in a village in Choloma, Cortes.

A year ago Carlos established his grocery store business.  He sells basic needs products like rice, beans, flour, pastas, sugar, and soft drinks, etc.  His wife helps him tend to the customers.  Twice a week he works at a textile company where he gets extra income.  The other days he devotes himself to the grocery store.

He is requesting a loan for 10,000 lempiras to buy food products like basic grains, sugar, and soft drinks, etc.  He has had three previous loans, and they have helped him to increase sales.

His goal is to always keep his business stocked and to have products available for the customers.

loans.use: to stock his business with products like basic grains, sugar, and soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Kuña Katypyry Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de Encarnación surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la Fundación,  el grupo se encuentra actualmente en el 13º  ciclo y opera con la Fundación desde el año 2007. Ellas son todas amigas y vecinas y ven una gran oportunidad de progreso para ellas y sus familias.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Dorotea tiene 2 hijos  esta acompañada con el Sr. Guillermo quien es Albañil y ella se dedica hace varios años a la venta de ropas. Cuenta la Sra. Dorotea que el crédito que recibe de la Fundación lo utiliza para la compra de prendas, y esta vez solicita nuevamente uno para la compra de más prendas, con lo cual podrá surtirse y de esa forma tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: The Encarnación Group came about as the result of the efforts of one of its members to contact the Fundación Paraguaya [Paraguay Foundation]. Currently, the group is in its 13th loan cycle, and has been working with the Foundation since 2007. The members are all friends and neighbors. They all see an opportunity to get ahead for each of them and their families. One of the members of the group is Dorotea. She has two children and is accompanied by Guillermo, who is a construction worker. Dorotea has sold clothing for several years. She says that she will use the loan she receives from the Foundation to purchase clothing, and that this time she is requesting a new loan to purchase more clothing, which she will use to supply her business, and in this way have more variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Zakym Group

texts.ru:
Махабат – лидер группы «Закым», ей 28 лет, имеет 3-х детей.  Махабат занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес  с суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS).  Также Махабат  выращивает фасоль и картофель, продавая затем урожай в сезон.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Махабат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку теленка.  Доходы от кредита Махабат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья. 

Сабырбеку 27 лет. В целях развития своего бизнеса, Сабырбек обратился в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп коз.  Доходы от кредита Сабырбек планирует вложить в постройку сарая. 
 
Надире 26 лет, замужем, воспитывает одну дочь. В целях развития своего бизнеса, Надира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп теленка.
texts.en:
Makhabat is the leader of the Zakym group. He is 28 years old and has three children. Makhabat raises livestock. He started this business with 15,000 som (KGS). Makhabat also grows beans and potatoes, which he sells in season. 

With the goal of further development of his business, Makhabat came to the company Bai-Tushum and Partners for a 15,000 som (KGS) loan to buy calves. Makhabat plans to invest income from the loan into further increasing his head of cattle. 

Sabyrbek is 27 years old. He came to the Bai-Tushum and Partners company for a 15,000 com KGS to develop his business by buying goats. Sabyrbek plans to use income from the loan to build a barn. 

Nadira is 26 years old and is raising a daughter. In order to develop his business, Nadira came to the Bai-Tushum and Partners company for a 15,000 com KGS loan in order to purchase a calf.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.ru: Абдурасул женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Он очень трудолюбивый, пунктуальный человек, который занимается купле- продажей скота более 20 лет. Он имеет богатый опыт в этой сфере бизнеса, и знает все слабые стороны бизнеса. Абдурасул также занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов и держит свой скот за счет отходов от выращивания культур. Абдурасул запрашивает займ для покупки 2 голов крупного рогатого скота, а также на остальную сумму хочет купить семена пшеницы для посева. Абдурасул надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Abdurasul is married and is raising two children. He is a very hardworking and punctual person. He has worked in the buying and sales of livestock for over 20 years. He has extensive experience in this sphere of business and knows the business's weak points. Abdurasul also grows crops and feeds his animals with the crop waste. Abdurasul is asking for a loan to buy two heads of cattle. Also, with the remaining sum he wants to buy wheat seed for planting. Abdurasul is hoping for your help and kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle and seeds

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio del trabajo en conjunto de todas ellas. Son personas muy trabajadoras y por sobre todo muy luchadoras.
Mirtha es una de las integrantes del grupo, y nos comenta que tiene una modesta peluquería con las comodidades que necesita para poder trabajar en lo que le gusta. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia. Ella solicita el crédito para poder surtir su salón con los artículos que más usa, como ser spray, tintes, tijeras, ruleros, esmaltes y demás.
El grupo está contento por la ayuda que la fundación paraguaya y kiva les da.
texts.en:
This committee is from the City of San Lorenzo.  The members of the committee have as their principal objective helping each other through the work that they all do together.  They are very hard-working people and more than anything real fighters.

Mirtha is one of the members of the group.  She tells us that she has a modest beauty salon with all the conveniences needed so that she can work in what she enjoys.  Her goals is to continue growing and in this way continue to help her family.  She is requesting the loan in order to supply her salon with the articles that she uses most such as spray, dyes, scissors, curlers, polishes, etc.  

The group is happy for the help that the Fundacion Paraguaya and Kiva give them.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her salon.

loans.name: Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, ellas son todas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, quienes se unieron con el propósito de poder ayudarse las unas a las otras y de esa forma procurar un mejor porvenir para sus familias.
Zulma es la presidenta del grupo, ella está casada y tiene 3 hijos, es una mujer muy activa y con ganas de salir adelante y ayudar a su familia, por quienes siempre se esfuerza al máximo y da lo mejor de ella día a día.
Zulma vende todo tipo de prendas, de estaciones y también de vestir, y es gracias a su trabajo que puede ayudar a su marido con los gastos del día a día.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, con las cuales podrá abastecerse y de esa forma cumplir con la demanda que tiene. Está muy contenta por que la ayuda de la fundación le ha sido muy buena para crecer.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of San Lorenzo.  They are all friends and neighbors from the city, who came together for the purpose of helping each other and in this way obtaining better prospects for their families.

Zulma is president of the group.  She is married and has three children.  She is a very active woman and wants to get ahead and help her family, for whom she always makes her maximum efforts and gives her best every day.

Zulma sells all types of clothing, for different seasons and also for dress occasions, and it is thanks to her work that she can help her husband with the daily expenses.  She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing, with which she will supply herself and in this way meet the demand that she has.  

She is very happy because the help that the Fundacion has given her has been very good for growth.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es: Zoila tiene 47 años vive(isla guayaquil) empezo su negocio hace 20 años.con esfuerso y ganas de salir adelante comenso su negocio copiando modelos de confeccion ya hecho para que de esa manera poder aprender a lograr hacer ella mismo sus propios modelos de ropa .ella tomo un cuarto de su casa como taller porque no tenia dinero para un local. trabaja todos los días depende de su trabajo su horario .es casada  con el préstamo comprara (maquina de coser, cemento y arena para construir mejor el cuarto donde tiene el taller de confeccion de ropa.
texts.en: Zoila is 47 years old and lives in Isla Guayaquil.  She started her business 20 years ago with hard work and a desire to do well.  She started out copying existing dressmaking designs so that she could learn to make her own clothing designs.  She set up a room in her home as a workshop because she didn't have enough money to pay for premises.  She works every day and her hours depend on the work she has to do.  Zoila is married and will use this loan to buy a sewing machine.  She will also buy cement and sand so that she can improve the room where she has her dressmaking workshop.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, cement and sand

loans.name: Geranios Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama "Geranios", está conformado por las señoras Rocio Humberta, Dolores, Rodemaribel, Sheyla Berta van a comprar con su préstamo harina, pintura, bolsa, pegamento, aceite, lijas, cinta canela, la señora Imelda va a comprar cacahuate, elotes, camotes, palanquetas, alegría, jamoncillo, la señora Cirina va a comprar elotes y cacahuate, la señora Edith Jhanet va a comprar obleas. 
La señora Dolores tiene 35 años de edad, ella vive en unión libre y tiene 2 hijos 1 varón y una mujer, el varón está estudiando la secundaria y la joven esta en bachillerato, ella vende obleas, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar harina, bolsas, pintura, aceite, cinta para elaborar oblea, ella inicio su negocio hace 4 años, aprendió a realizar estos dulces por que le ayudaba a una señora en la elaboración de obleas, ya después su esposo solicito un préstamo y compro la materia prima para iniciar en el negocio; su negocio es importante porque le provee económicamente para la alimentación y  gastos de la escuela de  sus hijos. 
Ella se siente orgullosa de valerse por ella misma, gracias a éste negocio y a lo bien administrado que lo tiene ha logrado ponerle techo a su casa y construir el taller donde trabaja, en su comunidad la mayoría se dedica a elaborar la oblea, ella utiliza las ganancias para comprar lo que falte en la casa, para invertir e ir ahorrando para comprar otra máquina de oblea, sus sueños y esperanzas son seguir trabajando mientras sus hijos terminan sus carrera y tengan una profesión y que sepan valerse por ellos mismos. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por su ayuda y que nos sigan apoyando con su préstamos  para que sigamos trabajando en los negocios y vivir mejor con las familias
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called "Geranios" (geraniums) and is made up of Señoras Rocio Humberta, Dolores, Rodemaribel and Sheyla Berta (who will use their shares of the loan to buy flour, paint, bags, glue, oil, sandpaper, ribbons and cinnamon); Imelda (who will buy peanuts, corn, sweet potatoes, peanut brittles, sesame seeds and candies); Cirina (who will buy corn and peanuts), and Edith Jhanet (who will buy wafers).

Dolores, aged 35, lives in a common-law marriage and is the mother of two children, a boy and a girl. The boy attends secondary school and the girl upper secondary school. Dolores sells wafers. She applies for this loan to buy flour, bags, paint, oil and ribbons to produce the wafers. She launched her business four years ago. She learned her activity when she was working for a woman who produced wafers. Later her husband applied for a loan to buy ingredients in order to start the business. This activity is important for Dolores, because it gives her the needed financial means to pay for food and tuition fees for her children.

Dolores is proud to provide for herself. Thanks to this well-managed business she was able to put a roof on her house and build her workshop. In her community many people produce wafers. She uses her profit to buy what is lacking at home and save some money with the idea of buying another machine to produce wafers. She dreams and hopes that she can keep on working until her children complete their education, get a job and can provide for themselves.

The members of this group want to thank Kiva and the microfinance institution Fundación Realidad for their help, and ask them to continue their financial support so that the group members can keep on working in their businesses and enjoy a better life with their families.

loans.use: to buy flour, bags, paint, oil and ribbons to produce wafers.

loans.name: Hulda

texts.en:
Hulda is 60 years old and from Kisumu. She is widowed and currently takes care of her youngest child.

She operates a cereal-selling and posho mill business and has been doing this for the last five years. She makes a monthly income of KES. 10,000. She is taking her third loan, which she will use to pay the school fees for her child.

Her dream is to open another posho mill outlet.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es: Nidia  de 49 años de edad es la propietaria de un estadero que incluye tienda de ranchos y víveres. Ella siempre ha tenido espíritu empresarial, pues cuando se inició lo hizo con un restaurante en compañía de su cuñado y allí también vendían bebidas frías. Ella se dio cuenta que el mayor volumen de sus ventas estaba en el consumo de cervezas y licores que en comidas, entonces decidió emprender un estadero  porque su socio se fue a otra ciudad y ella le devolvió el capital que este había invertido. En la actualidad trabaja apoyada con un amigo de mucha confianza porque adicionó la venta de artículos de la canasta familiar, a un lado de su venta de bebidas y licores; así el mayor movimiento lo hace la tienda  de lunes a viernes, mientras en su estanco el movimiento es de viernes a domingo y días festivos.  Su meta más adelante es convertir su tienda en un depósito, donde pequeños negocios y ventorrillos, puedan surtirse con productos de la canasta familiar, evitando el gasto generado por el transporte.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen, ranchos, víveres, bebidas, licores, provisionándose así, para los días festivos y aumentando sus inventarios en la tienda. El éxito de esta inversión radica en que gana descuentos por compras en volumen y gana también con la provisión de productos, que permanentemente aumentan, como los de la canasta familiar y esto favorece sus ingresos, estabiliza sus precios y genera un especial cuidado en su mercado de clientes.
texts.en:
Nidia, age 49, is the owner of a pub, which includes a snack and foodstuffs store.  She has always had a motivation for business.  When she started she did so with a restaurant together with her brother-in-law.  They also sold cold drinks there.

She realized that the greatest volume of their sales was for beer and liquor rather than food.  She then decided to undertake a pub.  Her business partner went to another city, and she returned the capital that her partner had invested.

She currently works with help from a very trustworthy friend.  She added the sale of basic needs items along with her drink and liquor sales.  This way the store gets the greatest movement from Monday through Friday, while her pub gets the greatest movement on Fridays to Sundays and holidays.

Her goal for later on is to convert her store into a warehouse where small businesses and sellers are able to stock up on basic needs products.  This would avoid the expense for transportation.

She is now applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy snacks, foodstuffs, drinks, and liquor in greater volume.  This way she will be getting provisions for the holidays and increasing the inventory in her store.  The success of this investment stems from the fact that she gets discounts for buying in volume.  She also wins because the cost of the products she stocks up on, like basic needs items, are always rising.  This favors her income, stabilizes her prices, and allows her to take special care of her customers.

loans.use: to buy snacks, foodstuffs, drinks, and liquor in greater volume.

loans.name: Pamela Del Rocio

texts.es: Pamela de 30 años vive (paraíso Guayaquil) le gusta mucho la cocina asi que la hermana y sus amigas  la incentivaron a que se ponga un comedor y lo hizo . con mucho esfuerzo y firmesa sale a trabajar todos los días de 9:00 a 19:00 con la ayuda de su hermana . aparte de su comedor  vende medicinas . en el futuro ella anhela tener un local  grande de medicinas .con el préstamo comprara (medicinas) ya que quiere mejorar sus ingresos, iniciando otro negocio de medicinas.
texts.en:
Pamela is 30 years old and lives in Guayaquil.  Because she enjoys cooking, her sister and friends encouraged her to open a small cafe and she did so.  It takes a lot of hard work, every day from 9 in the morning until 7 in the evening with the help of her sister.  In addition to the meals she prepares, she also sells health products on the side, and this is the business she wants to grow.  Her goal is to have a large store.  The loan will help her purchase more health products to sell.  


Pamela de 30 años vive (paraíso Guayaquil) le gusta mucho la cocina asi que la hermana y sus amigas  la incentivaron a que se ponga un comedor y lo hizo . con mucho esfuerzo y firmesa sale a trabajar todos los días de 9:00 a 19:00 con la ayuda de su hermana . aparte de su comedor  vende medicinas . en el futuro ella anhela tener un local  grande de medicinas .con el préstamo comprara (medicinas) ya que quiere mejorar sus ingresos, iniciando otro negocio de medicinas.

loans.use: to purchase more health products to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.es: La Sra. Editha tiene 44 años  es casada con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 11 y 22 años, se dedica  a la confección de prendas de vestir, ella tiene un taller de costura que se encuentran en la zona de San Antonio,  este préstamo es  la tercera secuencia dentro de la institución La Sra. Editha utilizara este préstamo para la compra de activo fijo por su negocio razón para solicitar este préstamo es compra de una maquina de costura industrial, la Sra. Editha enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la demanda de pedido por la temporada,  y utilizara los beneficios  en el crecimiento de su taller y así mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida de toda su familia, Editha es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Editha is 44 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 11 and 22.  Editha works as a seamstress in her small shop in the area of San Antonio.   This is her third loan with this institution, and she will use it to purchase an industrial sewing machine.  Editha needs to respond to her customers requests for the latest season's clothing.  By doing so can grow her business and increase her income, improving the quality of life for her and her family.  Editha is a very hard working person, and she is happy and grateful to the institution for the support they provide.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice lives in Yambio. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for three years. She is 33 years old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Joice heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 SDG in order to purchase charcoal to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past 22 years, Harriet has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, which sells chicken. 

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chicken feed, and will help Harriet to generate greater profits and increase her family's standard of living. Harriet hopes that in the future she will be able to open a retail shop. 

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Harriet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more chicken feed.

loans.name: Pastor

texts.en:
Pastor is 59 years old and lives in the town of Pakwach in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has eight children, five of whom are currently in school. For the past five years, Pastor has been working hard to manage his poultry and livestock farm, which sells chicken and goats. 

To help expand his business, Pastor has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chicken feed and goats for resale, and will help Pastor to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees. Pastor hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Pastor is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Pastor who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more chicken feed and goats for resale.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 35 year old man who is married to Evaline. He is from Kisumu town and he and his wife have two children, ages four and six. For the last 10 years, Paul has run a molasses business and he makes a monthly income of 8,000 KES. 

Paul is requesting his first loan to buy more stock of molasses. He will use the profits from his loan to improve his family's living standards. Paul's dream is to have a big molasses business.

loans.use: to buy molasses

loans.name: Abedalmueen

texts.en:
Abed-almueen is a 46-year-old married man form Gaza. He lives with his wife and six children.  Abed-almueen opened a sewing workshop in January 2011.

Abed-almueen is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine to increase his production capacity which will lead to increased profit and income.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en: Geofrey is a 31-year-old single man from Kakamega who supports only himself at the moment. Geofrey operates a motorcycle transport business and has been doing this for the last three years. He earns a monthly income of 11,700 KES. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy a new motorbike. He will then use the expected profits to pay back his loan. His dream is to run a successful business and also save for his future family.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Nikoloz

texts.en:
Nikoloz is from the village of Chognari, West Georgia. He is 35 years old, married, and lives with his family: wife Venera, their 5-year-old son, and their 4-year-old daughter. The children go to kindergarten. 

Nikoloz has a tractor. He provides agricultural services to local farmers and is paid for this service. It is the main source of the income for the family. Also the family has a small dairy farm with 3 milk cows. Venera produces cheese and sells it in the village. Total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Laris. 

Nikoloz is requesting a loan for fixing the tractor, as it is out of order. In late March farmers will start tilling their lands and Nikoloz’s tractor will be ready by that time. The family will get their expected income, which will be used for financing their daily needs.

loans.use: to fix a tractor.

loans.name: Deyanira

texts.es: Deyanira de 64 años, es una mujer casada que tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad, con los que sueña ver convertidos en personas exitosas. Ella  vive en la hermosa Cartagena de Indias,  ciudad  localizada a orillas del mar Caribe y  segundo centro urbano en importancia de la Costa Caribe colombiana, después de la ciudad de Barranquilla; allí tiene un negocio mediante el cual vende refrescos y alimentos congelados, que ella prepara con sus propias manos. Con su negocio ha logrado ingreso que favorecen el bienestar de su hogar y ella se siente muy satisfecha y con deseos de continuar creciendo, pero su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente, con relación a su creciente demanda y al propósito que se ha trazado. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con  el  que comprará materias primas,  como harina, aceites, lácteos, para la preparación de los productos congelados y refrescos y para tener inventarios de estos a una temperatura refrescante , que quite la sed de sus clientes en la cálida ciudad de Cartagena.
texts.en: Deyanira is 64 yeas old and married with 14 children, all grown up now, and she hopes that she will see them all become successful.  Deyanira lives in the beautiful city of Cartagena, which is located close to the Caribbean sea and is the second most important urban center along the Caribbean coast of Colombia after Barranquilla.   Deyanira has a small business selling drinks and snacks that she prepares with her own hands.  With her business, she has been able to generate income that helped improve her family's well being.    She is very happy and would like to continue to grow her business but there isn't enough capital to invest.  She is requesting a loan through Kiva and the Foundation Mario Santo Domingo, to purchase the items she needs most, such as flour, cooking oil and dairy products that she uses to prepare her drinks and snacks.  This will also give her more inventory, so she can continue serve her customers in the beautiful city of Cartegena.

loans.use: to stock her small restaurant with flour, cooking oil and dairy products which she uses to prepare meals.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 33 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. She lives in Yei. For the past two years, Charity has sold clothes. She heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this will be her first loan from BRAC. 

Charity is requesting an 800 SDG loan to purchase clothes to sell. She will use the extra income from her loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Nicolaza

texts.es:
"La señora Nicolaza tiene 20 años de edad vive en la zona de Chimore de la ciudad de Cochabamba, ella es casada con el señor Juan y tiene 1 hijo, trabaja como agricultor en un Chaco (terreno agrícola) alquilado por mas de 2 años donde produce  piña y otras frutas actividad que junto a su esposo desarrollan con mucho afán. 
Nicolaza es una persona muy trabajadora y fue adquiriendo conocimientos en la agricultura desde muy joven con el paso del tiempo llego a ahorrar un dinerito que pensaba utilizar en la compra de un lote urbano para poder dejarles como herencia a sus hijos, al pasar el tiempo sufrieron una estafa después de haber comprado un lote para su construcción, porque los timadores desaparecieron , es así que ahora la señora Nicolaza quedo desilusilucionada , pero la distracción de su trabajo fue borrando poco a poco el engaño, actualmente su producción de Piña se incremento ahora tienen tiempos de bonanza  y se encuentran felices juntos al cuidado de su único hijo. Sin embargo solicita un crédito para inducir  (madurar químicamente) su piña para poder lograr su primera cosecha esta gestión  y así recuperar el dinero perdido y aumentar en su producción. El crédito que solicita hará que sus tierras adelanten su cosecha y acondicionar su chaco para los siguientes cultivos, se le comento de los créditos Kiva y lo recibió con beneplácito y accedió a dar información y la predisposición que se requiere."
texts.en:
Nicolaza is 20 years old and lives in Chimore, in the city of Cochabamba.  She is married to Juan and has one child.  Nicolaza has been working as a farmer on a rented plot of land for more than two years.  She produces pineapple and other fruits.  She and her husband work together and put a lot of effort into their work.

Nicolaza is a very hard-working person who has been gaining knowledge in the field of agriculture since she was very young.  Over time she managed to save up some money which she planned to use to buy a plot of land in the city so that she could leave it to her children as an inheritance.  However, she was ripped off because after having paid for the lot on which to build, the sellers disappeared.  Nicolaza was disillusioned but the distraction of her work gradually allowed her to get over the con trick.  Nicolaza's pineapple production is increasing and now she and her husband have periods of prosperity and they both feel happy together caring for their only son.  

Nicolaza is requesting a loan to induce (chemically mature) her pineapples so that she can achieve her first harvest and thereby recoup her lost money and increase her production.  She will use the loan that she has requested to bring forward her harvest and get her farm ready for future crops.  When she heard about Kiva loans she was keen and agreed to provide the information and commitment that is required.

loans.use: to buy materials and supplies for producing pineapples

loans.name: Yolam

texts.en:
Yolam is 43 years old and lives in the town of Nebbi in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past two years, Yolam has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells general merchandise like plastic plates. 

To help expand his business, Yolam has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more plastic toy cars and cosmetics for resale, and will help Yolam to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees. Yolam hopes that in the future he will be able to turn the shop into a wholesale shop. 

Yolam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Yolam who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more plastic toy cars and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Keziah

texts.en:
Keziah, a 42-year-old business lady is married to Raphael, a businessman, and they are blessed with three children. Keziah has been rearing poultry for the past three years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,500 which she uses to support her family.

Having repaid her previous loan, Keziah is now requesting her third loan from KADET LTD to buy chicks and poultry feeds. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hope is to venture into pig-rearing.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds and chicks to rear.

loans.name: Busaira

texts.ru: Бусайре 63 года. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Бусайра в период развала Советского союза начала заниматься животноводством.  Начатое с 1,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. Благодаря упорному труду Бусайры, ее поголовье насчитывает 1 лошадь, 2 коровы и 10 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бусайра обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Бусайра планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Busaira is 63 years old.  During the collapse of the Soviet Union, Busaira took up animal husbandry as a source of income for her family.  Her business, which she began with 1,000 soms (KGS), today brings her 15,000 soms (KGS) per month from the sale of milk and dairy products.  Thanks to her persistent efforts, Busaira's herd now numbers one horse, two cows, and ten sheep.  

With the goal of further development of her business, Busaira applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 soms (KGS) for the purchase of livestock.   Busaira plans to reinvest the income in further increasing her herd.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Eugenio Espejo, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que cuenta con una riqueza natural y arquitectónica, es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde Diciembre de 1999, su clima es frió, pero su gente tiene un corazón muy cálido, mantienen la Cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Rosa tiene 41 años de edad, está separada de su esposo y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos, dos de sus hijos son casados y viven independientes, una de sus hijas ayuda en los quehaceres de su hogar y su ultimo hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña Rosa se dedica a la venta de comida, entrega almuerzos a sus clientes, trabaja en esta actividad de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Está en el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en víveres para el negocio de comidas y también va a comprar productos de primera necesidad para poner una pequeña tienda.

Su meta es crecer en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Rosa, 41, is a member of the Eugenio Espejo communal bank.  She lives in Cuenca, a city that has  rich natural beauty and architecture, and since December 1999 has been a World Heritage site. Cuenca has a cold climate but its people have warm hearts and they preserve the traditional culture of their past.

Rosa is separated from her common-law husband.  They had 4 children: 2 are married and live on their own, one daughter helps with the household chores, and the youngest son is in high school in the city. 

Rosa lives in her own house and she sells prepared food.and delivers lunches to her customers daily although not on a regular schedule.
This is her third loan from the communal bank and she will use it to buy supplies for her food business and also to purchase basic staples to set up a small store.
Her goal is for her businesses to grow.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and staple supplies for a store

loans.name: La Lomita Group

texts.es:
El comité La Lomita nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  las integrantes del comité trabajan arduamente y por ello son reconocidas en su barrio, quieren ayudar a su familia y de esa forma tener un mejor estilo de vida y crecer como personas.
La Sra. Angelica presidenta del grupo tiene 35 años, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y capaz de liderar un grupo numeroso como lo es este, durante todos estos ciclos ha demostrado ganas de superación y muy buena coordinación con sus compañeras. Ella se dedica  a la mercería, donde vende todo tipo de artículos, como se ropas, calzados, artículos de bazar y demás. Gracias a la gran variedad que tiene ha podido formarse una buena clientela, lo cual la ha ayudado siempre.
Ella solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva para la compra de ropas, zapatos, artículos de bazar y demás artículos para poder seguir vendiendo y creciendo como comerciante.
texts.en:
The La Lomita communal bank was born through the actions and support of another group that was working in this city.

This communal bank is located in the city of San Lorenzo. The group members work hard, and are well-known for this in their neighborhood. They want to help their families, and that way have a better lifestyle and grow as individuals.

Angelica, the chair of the group, is 35, and a very enterprising woman, able to lead a large group such as this. During all these loan cycles she has shown a desire for self-improvement, and very good coordination with her fellow group members.

She has a notions store where she sells all kinds of goods, such as clothing, footwear, stationery, and other items. Thanks to the great variety that she has, she has been able to establish a good clientele; something that has always helped her.

She is applying for the help of the Foundation and Kiva to buy clothing, shoes, stationery items, and other goods so that she can continue selling, and growing as a business person.

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes, stationery items, and other goods.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 27 years old and is married with four children, three of whom are currently in school. She lives in the town of Arua Hill in the Arua region of Uganda. For the past five years, Winnie has been working hard to manage her small business where she sells silver fish. 

Winnie is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX to purchase more silver fish to resell. This will help to generate greater profits to buy food to feed her family and expand her business. In the future, she hopes that her business will continue to expand.  

Winnie is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). This program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Winnie who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase silver fish to sell

loans.name: Nurillo

texts.ru: Нурилло женат и на воспитании имеет шестерых детей. Более 20 лет он занимается купле- продажей скота, а также одновременно занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. Ему выгодно содержать скот, так как отходы от выращивания идут на их корм. В бизнесе помогают взрослые дети, а жена занимается домохозяйством. Нурилло запрашивает займ для покупки мелкого рогатого скота и корма для них. Нурилло заранее благодарен всем кредиторам за их помощь и доброту.
texts.en:
Nurillo is married and raising six children.  For more than 20 years he has been trading cattle and also farming.  It's profitable for him to keep cattle because he can use the plant material left over after harvest as feed.  His adult children help him with the business and his wife takes care of their home.  

Nurillo is requesting a loan to purchase sheep, goats, and feed.  Nurillo is grateful in advance to his lenders for their help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle and feed

loans.name: Virginia Amable

texts.es:
La Señora Virginia es socia del banco comunal Eugenio Espejo, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que cuenta con una riqueza natural y arquitectónica, es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde Diciembre de 1999, su clima es frió pero su gente tiene  un corazón muy cálido, mantienen la Cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Virginia tiene 40 año, está separada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 23 y 21 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado e independiente y su segunda hija estudia en una universidad de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar.

Ella trabaja como emplada privada de lunes a sabados pero en su tiempo libre se dedica a la venta de ropa, actividad en la que se encuentra hace 21 años, se inicio en este trabajo porque le gusta la atención al cliente y no depende de jefes, pero ha sufrido de un robo en su casa por lo que le ha afectado económicamente, pero como es una mujer luchadora está saliendo adelante poco a poco.
 
El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió comprando ropa, pero por el robo en su casa se atraso en los pagos pero ya realizo la cancelación del crédito en su totalidad. 
Ahora esta pudiendo un nuevo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para volver a incrementar su negocio. El Banco comunal le gusta por las charlas educativas, el servicio personalizado que les brindan y el compañerismo del grupo.

Su meta es tener su propio almacén de ropa.
texts.en:
Sra. Virginia is a member of the Eugenio Espejo Communal Bank and lives in Cuenca, a city of natural and architectural riches.  It has been a World Heritage Site since December, 1999. It’s climate is cold but its inhabitants have warm hearts and retain the culture and traditions of its people.

Virginia is 40 years old and separated. She conceived two children in the marriage, now 23 and 21 years of age. The oldest, a son, is married and independent, while her daughter is studying at a university in the city. She does not own her home but lives in a relative’s house.

She works as a private employee from Monday to Saturday, but in her free time she sells clothing, a business she has had for 21 years. She started this work because she enjoys serving customers and does not have to depend on bosses; however she experienced a burglary at home, which affected her financially. Nevertheless, because she is a fighter, she is moving ahead slowly.

She invested the money from her previous loan in buying clothes but because of the burglary she fell behind in her payments. However, she has already finished paying off that debt in full and is now applying for a new loan. She will invest it in the purchase of clothing in order to return to and increase her business. She likes the communal bank because of the educational talks, personalized service and group fellowship.
 
Her goal is to have her own clothing store.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Reida

texts.en:
Reida lives in Yei. She sells charcoal and has been in business for three years. She is 30-years-old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Reida heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Vilma Cordelia

texts.es: La emprendedora Vilma Cordelia es una emprendedora que toda la vida ha trabajado para salir adelante, ella ya ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, y ha demostrado en el transcurso de su crédito ser una persona responsable y con deseos de superación con su negocio tiene metas en la vida, actualmente  esta emprendedora está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de  recargas y ciertos productos de la pulpería  que sus clientes le están solicitando.
texts.en: Hard working Vilma Cordelia is an enterprising woman who has worked her whole life in order to get ahead. She has been working with Fundacion León since 2000 and has demonstrated throughout her credit history that she is a responsible person with the desire to excel in her business. She has goals in life. Currently she is an entrepreneur and is applying for funding to buy chargers and certain products for her convenience store that her customers are requesting.

loans.use:
to purchase chargers and certain products for her store that her
customers are requesting.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with 5 children and none of them is in school. She takes care of additional family members (older parents). 

She sells charcoal at the market on retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. 

Mary’s goals and aspirations are to expand her business into a wholesale business and also to build her own house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but doesn’t have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Roza

texts.ru: Розе 55 лет, воспитала двух детей.  В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Роза  в 1980 году начала заниматься животноводством.  Начатое с 20,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи  молочных и мясных  продуктов. Благодаря упорному труду Розы, ее поголовье насчитывает  1 дойную корову и 10 овец, заготовлено 150 тюков сена. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Роза обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Роза планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Roza is 55 years old and raised two children. She began to raise livestock in 1980 as the primary income earner for the family. Having started her business with 20,000 som (KGS), it now brings in around 5,000 som (KGS) a month from sale of meat and milk products. Thanks to Roza's persistant hard work her animals now number 1 milking cow and 10 sheep, and she has a stock of 150 bales of hay. In order to further develop her business, Roza came to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) for purchase of livestock. Roza plans to use the income generated to invest in further expansion of her herd.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 32 years old and lives in the town of Arua Hill in the Arua region of Uganda. He is widowed and has 2 children who are currently in school. For the past 3 years, Lawrence has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Lawrence has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like sugar and cooking oil for resale, and will help Lawrence to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Lawrence hopes that in the future he will be able to expand business. 

Lawrence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Lawrence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like sugar and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Lilias

texts.en:
Lilias lives in Yei. She sells clothes, and has been in business for three years. She is 32 years old, married and has three children; two of the children are still in school. 

Lilias heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,000 Sudan pounds in order to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Yei. She sells clothes, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married and has four children; all of the children are still in school. 

Sarah heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudan pounds in order to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Ayinonkpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYINONKPO est formé de trois personnes qui  vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Mondohoudé, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Mondohoudé est âgée de 38 ans et a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Mondohoudé est mariée à un tailleur du nom de Alexis. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En dehors de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Mondohoudé vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Pour  faire face à ses différentes charges, Mondohoudé vend des galettes dans une région du Benin depuis près de onze ans. Mondohoudé s’approvisionne dans une ville du Benin. Dans le souci de renforcer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Mondohoudé désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Mondohoudé sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AYINONKPO, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The AYINONKPO group consists of three women who live in the same neighborhood.  The group's representative, Mondohoudé, is raising her hand in the photo.  It is the fourth time that the group is requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to increase their level of activity.

Mondohoudé is 38 years old and left school at the primary level.  She is married to a tailor named Alexis.  The couple has three children, all in school, and all their dependents.  Besides their children, the couple takes care of another child.  Mondohoudé lives with her husband and children.  The couple jointly takes care of the household expenses.  

In order to cope with her various expenses, Mondohoudé has been selling "galettes" (flat round cakes) in one of the regions of Benin, for almost eleven years.  She stocks up in a city in Benin.

In order to strengthen her activity and to better meet her customers' needs, she would like to increase her stock of supplies.  To this end, Mondohoudé is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the AYINONKPO group.  Previous loans have been well repaid.

loans.use: to buy "galettes" (flat round cakes)

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Caleb is a 49 year old man from Kakamega. He is married to Grace and they have four children aged 17, 15, 12 and 8 years.

Caleb runs a tailoring business, a business he has been doing for the last six years, and makes a monthly income of KES. 3,700. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to a buy new sewing machine and also stock of textile material. His profits will be used to diversify to other businesses.

His dream is to start a business for his wife Grace.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and more stock of textile material.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a 59 year old a business lady. She is married to Joseph, a business man, and they are blessed with four children. She has had a livestock trading business for the past three years, with a monthly income of KES 5,400 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her third loan term with KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. Tabitha will use the loan to purchase more goats and sheep for selling. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a pickup for transporting livestock to different markets.

loans.use: to purchase more goats and sheep to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene, a 29-year-old mixed crop farmer, is married to Gabriel, a businessman, and they are blessed with two children. She has been a farmer for the past seven years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000 which she uses to support her family.
